title: ‘Find Me’ Review: Better Left Unspoken
text: Literary sequels are tricky. When a book is beautiful enough to stoke demands for more, it probably means the author should leave well enough alone. Unless the hero goes by Rabbit, Smiley or Zuckerman, the result tends to be uneven. Alas, such is the case with “Find Me,” André Aciman’s much-anticipated follow-up to his luminous debut novel, “Call Me by Your Name” (2007), made famous by an Oscar-winning adaptation in 2017. It is only natural to want more time with Elio and Oliver, who are a precocious 17 and a dapper 24 when they fall deeply and desirously in love over a few precious weeks on the Italian Riviera. description: A much-anticipated sequel that dispenses with many of the ingredients that made the earlier book so moving.
